trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server Farm | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server Farm | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Quickly create a new basic or highly-available SharePoint Server 2013 farm using SharePoint Server Farm in the Azure Preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Quickly create a new basic or highly-available SharePoint Server 2013 farm using SharePoint Server Farm in the Azure Preview portal.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server Farm
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server Farm

trans-unit.source: With SharePoint Server Farm, the Microsoft Azure Preview Portal automatically creates a pre-configured SharePoint Server 2013 farm for you.
trans-unit.target: With SharePoint Server Farm, the Microsoft Azure Preview Portal automatically creates a pre-configured SharePoint Server 2013 farm for you.

trans-unit.source: This can save you a lot of time when you need a basic or high-availability SharePoint farm for a development and testing environment or if you are evaluating SharePoint Server 2013 as a collaboration solution for your organization.
trans-unit.target: This can save you a lot of time when you need a basic or high-availability SharePoint farm for a development and testing environment or if you are evaluating SharePoint Server 2013 as a collaboration solution for your organization.

trans-unit.source: The basic SharePoint farm consists of three virtual machines in this configuration.
trans-unit.target: The basic SharePoint farm consists of three virtual machines in this configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sharepointfarm</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sharepointfarm</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use this farm configuration for a simplified setup for SharePoint app development or your first-time evaluation of SharePoint 2013.
trans-unit.target: You can use this farm configuration for a simplified setup for SharePoint app development or your first-time evaluation of SharePoint 2013.

trans-unit.source: The high-availability SharePoint farm consists of nine virtual machines in this configuration.
trans-unit.target: The high-availability SharePoint farm consists of nine virtual machines in this configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>sharepointfarm</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>sharepointfarm</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use this farm configuration to test higher client loads, high availability of the external SharePoint site, and SQL Server AlwaysOn for a SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: You can use this farm configuration to test higher client loads, high availability of the external SharePoint site, and SQL Server AlwaysOn for a SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: You can also use this configuration for SharePoint app development in a high-availability environment.
trans-unit.target: You can also use this configuration for SharePoint app development in a high-availability environment.

trans-unit.source: For the configuration details for both of these farms, see <link><linkText>SharePoint Server Farm Configuration Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the configuration details for both of these farms, see <link><linkText>SharePoint Server Farm Configuration Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Stepping through configuration
trans-unit.target: Stepping through configuration

trans-unit.source: To create your SharePoint farm with the SharePoint Server Farm template, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To create your SharePoint farm with the SharePoint Server Farm template, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure Preview Portal, click New > Compute > SharePoint Server Farm.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure Preview Portal, click New > Compute > SharePoint Server Farm.

trans-unit.source: If SharePoint Server Farm does not appear, click New > Compute > Marketplace, type SharePoint in Search Compute, and then click SharePoint Server Farm.
trans-unit.target: If SharePoint Server Farm does not appear, click New > Compute > Marketplace, type SharePoint in Search Compute, and then click SharePoint Server Farm.

trans-unit.source: In the SharePoint Server Farm pane, click Create.
trans-unit.target: In the SharePoint Server Farm pane, click Create.

trans-unit.source: In the Create a SharePoint farm pane, type the name of a resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the Create a SharePoint farm pane, type the name of a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Type a user name and password for a local administrator account on each virtual machine in your farm.
trans-unit.target: Type a user name and password for a local administrator account on each virtual machine in your farm.

trans-unit.source: Choose a name and password that is difficult to guess, record it, and store it in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Choose a name and password that is difficult to guess, record it, and store it in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: If you want the high-availability farm, click Enable high availability.
trans-unit.target: If you want the high-availability farm, click Enable high availability.

trans-unit.source: To configure your domain controllers, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To configure your domain controllers, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), forest root domain name (default is contoso.com), and the size of your domain controllers (default is A1).
trans-unit.target: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), forest root domain name (default is contoso.com), and the size of your domain controllers (default is A1).

trans-unit.source: To configure your SQL servers, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To configure your SQL servers, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), the size of your SQL servers (default is A5), a database access account name and password (the default is to use the administrator account), and a SQL server service account name (the default is sqlservice) and password (the default is to use the same password as the administrator account).
trans-unit.target: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), the size of your SQL servers (default is A5), a database access account name and password (the default is to use the administrator account), and a SQL server service account name (the default is sqlservice) and password (the default is to use the same password as the administrator account).

trans-unit.source: To configure your SharePoint servers, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To configure your SharePoint servers, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), the size of your SharePoint servers (default is A2), a SharePoint user account (the default is sp_setup) and password, a SharePoint farm account name (the default is sp_farm) and password, and a SharePoint farm passphrase.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a host name prefix (the default is the resource group name), the size of your SharePoint servers (default is A2), a SharePoint user account (the default is sp_setup) and password, a SharePoint farm account name (the default is sp_farm) and password, and a SharePoint farm passphrase.

trans-unit.source: The default is to use the administrator password for the SharePoint user account, farm account, and passphrase.
trans-unit.target: The default is to use the administrator password for the SharePoint user account, farm account, and passphrase.

trans-unit.source: To configure optional configuration settings for the virtual network, storage account, or diagnostics, click the corresponding arrow.
trans-unit.target: To configure optional configuration settings for the virtual network, storage account, or diagnostics, click the corresponding arrow.

trans-unit.source: To specify the subscription, click the arrow.
trans-unit.target: To specify the subscription, click the arrow.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click Create.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click Create.

trans-unit.source: The domain controller does not have the Active Directory Management tools installed by default.
trans-unit.target: The domain controller does not have the Active Directory Management tools installed by default.

trans-unit.source: To install them, run the Install-WindowsFeature AD-Domain-Services -IncludeManagementTools command from an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on the domain controller virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To install them, run the Install-WindowsFeature AD-Domain-Services -IncludeManagementTools command from an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt on the domain controller virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Accessing and managing the SharePoint farms
trans-unit.target: Accessing and managing the SharePoint farms

trans-unit.source: The SharePoint farms have a pre-configured endpoint to allow unauthenticated web traffic (TCP port 80) to the SharePoint web server for an Internet-connected client computer.
trans-unit.target: The SharePoint farms have a pre-configured endpoint to allow unauthenticated web traffic (TCP port 80) to the SharePoint web server for an Internet-connected client computer.

trans-unit.source: This endpoint is to a pre-configured team site.
trans-unit.target: This endpoint is to a pre-configured team site.

trans-unit.source: To access this team site:
trans-unit.target: To access this team site:

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse, and then click Resource Groups.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse, and then click Resource Groups.

trans-unit.source: In the list of resource groups, click the name of your SharePoint farm resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the list of resource groups, click the name of your SharePoint farm resource group.

trans-unit.source: In the pane for your SharePoint farm resource group, click Deployment history.
trans-unit.target: In the pane for your SharePoint farm resource group, click Deployment history.

trans-unit.source: In the Deployment history pane, click Microsoft.SharePointFarm.
trans-unit.target: In the Deployment history pane, click Microsoft.SharePointFarm.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft.SharePointFarm pane, select the URL in the SHAREPOINTSITEURL field and copy it.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft.SharePointFarm pane, select the URL in the SHAREPOINTSITEURL field and copy it.

trans-unit.source: From your Internet browser, paste the URL into the address field.
trans-unit.target: From your Internet browser, paste the URL into the address field.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user account credentials that you specified when you created the farm.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user account credentials that you specified when you created the farm.

trans-unit.source: From the Central Administration SharePoint site, you can configure My sites, SharePoint applications, and other functionality.
trans-unit.target: From the Central Administration SharePoint site, you can configure My sites, SharePoint applications, and other functionality.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To access the Central Administration SharePoint site:
trans-unit.target: To access the Central Administration SharePoint site:

trans-unit.source: From the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse, and then click Resource Groups.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure Preview Portal, click Browse, and then click Resource Groups.

trans-unit.source: In the list of resource groups, click the name of your SharePoint farm resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the list of resource groups, click the name of your SharePoint farm resource group.

trans-unit.source: In the pane for your SharePoint farm resource group, click Deployment history.
trans-unit.target: In the pane for your SharePoint farm resource group, click Deployment history.

trans-unit.source: In the Deployment history pane, click Microsoft.SharePointFarm.
trans-unit.target: In the Deployment history pane, click Microsoft.SharePointFarm.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft.SharePointFarm pane, select the URL in the SHAREPOINTCENTRALADMINURL field and copy it.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft.SharePointFarm pane, select the URL in the SHAREPOINTCENTRALADMINURL field and copy it.

trans-unit.source: From your Internet browser, paste the URL into the address field.
trans-unit.target: From your Internet browser, paste the URL into the address field.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user account credentials that you specified when you created the farm.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user account credentials that you specified when you created the farm.

trans-unit.source: Notes:
trans-unit.target: Notes:

trans-unit.source: The Azure Preview Portal creates these virtual machines within the specified subscription.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Preview Portal creates these virtual machines within the specified subscription.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Preview Portal creates both of these farms in a cloud-only virtual network with an Internet-facing web presence.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Preview Portal creates both of these farms in a cloud-only virtual network with an Internet-facing web presence.

trans-unit.source: There is no site-to-site VPN or ExpressRoute connection back to your organization network.
trans-unit.target: There is no site-to-site VPN or ExpressRoute connection back to your organization network.

trans-unit.source: You can administer these servers through Remote Desktop connections.
trans-unit.target: You can administer these servers through Remote Desktop connections.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: The SharePoint Server Farm feature of the Azure Preview Portal creates virtual machines in Service Management.
trans-unit.target: The SharePoint Server Farm feature of the Azure Preview Portal creates virtual machines in Service Management.

trans-unit.source: To create SharePoint Server 2013 farms in Resource Manager, see <link><linkText>Deploy SharePoint Farms with Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To create SharePoint Server 2013 farms in Resource Manager, see <link><linkText>Deploy SharePoint Farms with Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title></link>.
